Event.0: In what was thought to be the lowest-attended baseball game in MLB history, the Baltimore Orioles defeated the Chicago White Sox, 8–2, in an empty Camden Yards, Baltimore; the game was closed to fans because of rioting in the city following the death of an African American man who was fatally injured while in police custody.
Event.1:
British royal wedding
On this day in 2011, Prince William of Wales, second in line to the British throne, married his longtime girlfriend, Catherine Middleton, in a lavish ceremony broadcast to millions of television viewers.
Event.2: Chemical Weapons Convention of 1993 comes into force, outlaws production, stockpiling and use of chemical weapons among its signatories
Event.3: Riots erupted in Los Angeles in response to the verdict of a highly publicized trial of four white Los Angeles police officers who were acquitted of charges related to the 1991 beating of Rodney King, a black motorist who had resisted arrest.
Event.4: A tropical cyclone struck Bangladesh, killing an estimated 140,000 people and causing 10 million to lose their homes.
Event.5: Cyclone strikes the Chittagong district in Bangladesh, killing 139,000 people and leaving 10 million homeless
Event.6: Wrecking cranes began tearing down the Berlin Wall at the Brandenburg Gate
Event.7: Vietnam War: US begins to evacuate its citizens from Saigon in Operation Frequent Wind in response to advancing North Vietnamese forces, bringing an end to US involvement in the war
Event.8: "Respect" single released by Aretha Franklin (Billboard Song of the Year 1967)
Event.9:
Michelle Pfeiffer
American actress
was born
Event.10:
Daniel Day-Lewis
British actor
was born
Event.11:
Jerry Seinfeld
American comedian
was born
Event.12: Comedian Jerry Seinfeld, whose television show Seinfeld was a landmark of American pop culture in the late 20th century, was born in Brooklyn, New York.
Event.13: Actor Sidney Poitier (23) weds model Juanita Hardy
Event.14: The U.S. Seventh Army liberated tens of thousands of inmates at the Nazi concentration camp in Dachau, Germany.
Event.15: Adolf Hitler (56) marries Eva Braun (33) in the Führerbunker, Berlin
Event.16: US Army liberates 31,601 in Nazi concentration camp in Dachau, Germany
Event.17:
Bernie Madoff
American hedge-fund investor
was born
Event.18: Orchestral conductor Zubin Mehta was born in Bombay (Mumbai), India.
Event.19:
Willie Nelson
American musician
was born
Event.20: 1st broadcast of "One Man's Family" on NBC radio, longest-running dramatic serial on US radio (ends 1959)
Event.21: 1st official International Weightlifting Federation Champ in Tallinn, Estonia
Event.22: About 10,000 British troops surrendered to Ottoman Turks at Al-Kūt, Iraq, following a five-month siege during World War I.
Event.23: Irish republicans abandon the post office in Dublin and surrender unconditionally, marking the end of the Easter Rising
Event.24: American composer, bandleader, and pianist Duke Ellington, among the most significant figures in jazz history, was born.
Event.25: Novelist Edith Wharton (23) weds Edward Robbins Wharton (35)
Event.26: Battle of Gate Pa (Pukehinahina): 1,700 British troops suffer their worst defeat of the New Zealand Wars at the hands of 230 entrenched Maori warriors in Tauranga
Event.27: New Orleans falls to Union forces during US Civil War
Event.28: French national heroine Joan of Arc and her troops entered the besieged city of Orléans during the Hundred Years' War.
